title: The Block credit card scandal: Tess accuses Mitch and Mark of cheating
text:
Last week, she and her husband Luke lashed out at The Block's 'bullying' producers and said they had been unfairly portrayed as 'lazy'.

And on Monday, Tess was on the warpath yet again as she hit out at rival couple Mitch and Mark, accusing them of 'cheating'.

Speaking to NW magazine, the 28-year-old said she believes the 'stylish grandads' spent their own cash to reach the top of the leaderboard.

Claims: The Block has been rocked by a 'cheating' scandal as Tess (pictured) accuses Mitch and Mark of breaking the rules by 'using their own credit card to buy things'

It's against the rules of The Block for teams to spend their own money, and they must stick to the budgets allocated to them by producers.

'They used their own personal credit card to buy things when everyone else was told they weren't allowed to,' Tess alleged.

However, Mitch and Mark have strongly denied Tess' claims and insist they haven't broken any of the show's rules.

'Tess is lying and it's all speculation,' Mark said. 'We think they're just really having a hard time and lashing out.'

Not true! Mitch and Mark have denied Tess' allegations, insisting they haven't broken any rules

Not coping: Last week, Tess and her husband Luke (right) lashed out at The Block's 'bullying' producers and said they had been unfairly portrayed as 'lazy'

Speaking to News.com.au last week, Luke and Tess unleashed on The Block's producers and claimed they had been portrayed unfairly.

Luke, 30, said: 'We're getting sick of how they're editing us as being these big lazy pr**ks who don't get off their a**e and do a single thing.

'We're just getting painted as these lazy people and we're bloody sick of it. Even the other contestants have contacted us to say, "That didn't happen, that was taken out of context".'

Snapped: Tess, who has admitted she struggled to cope during filming, recently unleashed on host Scott Cam (left) after he confronted her and Luke about their poor budgeting skills

Tess, who has admitted she struggled to cope during filming, recently unleashed on host Scott Cam after he confronted the couple about their poor budgeting skills.

'This is literally destroying us. It is. Luke and I f**king hate each other, we don't stop fighting. What this is doing to us is not good,' she said.

On Sunday's episode of The Block, Tess and Luke finished with the lowest score (20.5) for their hallway, stairs and media room reveal.

authors: David Wu For Daily Mail Australia
